column4: is it normal for my laptop to run hotter with ubuntu 10.10  as opposed to win 7?
you could try installing the 'powertop' stuff - that may give you some tweaks to  reduce its power and heat.
its possible that win7 has some better drivers/optmized things to let it throttle down the cpu better on win7.
powertop can give a lot of hints and info. overwhelming in some cases.
you mean 'sudo powertop' (or whatever it is)
